Posts.Content: mc33 wrote: Hi,  I am in search of a physician who knows IBC well.  My mother died of IBC at age 33 and was diagnosed around age 28.  My sister is now 25 and she has a discolored bump under her arm pit that has been there for a couple of months and now has a discolored bump on her nipple (on the same side as the arm pit bump).  She was seen this week and is due for a diagnostic mammography in a week and a half.  She was seen in the white mountains in northern NH.  I don't know how high the quality of medical services might be in that area.  I know IBC is extremely difficult to diagnose and is not typically detectable through a mammography.  I want my sister to be seen by someone who knows IBC extremely well as soon as possible.  Does anyone know of resources that might help me?  I have been doing some research and I have not been able to find any IBC specialists.  Please let me know if you can.  Thanks so much.   Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: IBC Specialist Needed mc33 truenorthk9
